name: outdress
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to wear more impressive clothes than someone else: The wedding was notable for the fact that the bride's mother had outdressed the bride herself. Always wear smart clothes for an interview, but not too smart — you don't want to outdress the interviewers.
More examplesFewer examplesIt's always a bit competitive when we go on a big night out as we try to outdress one another.I felt out-dressed by my friends, who all had dinner jackets on.Even though the American team beat us, we at least managed to outdress them.
